website_summaries.verdict: As long as you're OK with a noise-isolating design, the Anker Liberty Air are an excellent alternative to the AirPods that cost half the price.
pros: Anker's Liberty Air True Wireless earphones cost half the price of Apple's AirPods and sound as good or better
They offer solid wireless performance, five hours of battery life and come with a compact charging case that delivers an extra three charges
cons: Charging case uses standard Micro-USB not USB-C
if you don't get a tight seal, sound quality isn't as good

customer_reviews.title: Constant connection issues
customer_reviews.text: Can't in good conscience give this product a positive review. Anker customer service is great and helped me replace my first set. However, connection issues occur almost immediately on use. Trying pairing again, etc, and only get the same results. Audio constantly stutters and connection for left ear bud is always dipping out randomly. Both of my units had the same issue and I can only conclude that the product just doesn't work well. Also call quality is really as bad as everyone says. Really disappointing at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotah

customer_reviews.title: Audio extremely muddled, poor fit, disconnect issues
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a defective pair as these are the worst sounding headphones I have ever used. The audio was extremely muddled, sounded like I had my head underwater. I’ve had a better audio experience with dollar store earbuds. Beyond that, they slightest moved knocked them out of my ears, I tried ever tip supplied and none of them gave a proper fit in which they won’t fall out. As for pairing, it seems they will automatically disconnect after about a minute with no audio which is very frustrating when looking for something to play. They only way I could them to reconnect is to put them in the case and take them out again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Williams

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Airpods alternative with one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: In general, they work pretty well. The max volume could be louder, and the sound quality is alright, but not mind-blowing. Connectivity is as reliable as any other Bluetooth devices I've used. I was able to go for runs without them falling out of my ears. The most important note I have is that the right earbud stopped charging after three months. I tried resetting, tried cleaning with compressed air, no luck. But, I scratched the contacts on the earbud with a paperclip vigorously, and it now works again. So... probably a design flaw that something builds up on those surfaces, but hopefully that helps somebody get more life out of their investment.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Miller

customer_reviews.title: more likely 1 + 1 item
customer_reviews.text: once you put the right side ear-bud to charger, your left one's not going to work. not only play music, talking is only for right side earbud too. 1 + 1 and after $85 waste and I am still looking for another one. SAVE your $80.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Anker does it again!
customer_reviews.text: A year or two back, I purchased a pair of Soundbuds Slim during a sale, and was completely blown away by the value and the quality. Lately, I've been kinda feeling the itch to go to wireless earbuds, and ALMOST bought a pair of Airpods. After doing a bit of research, I found these. Just received them earlier today, and I have to say, I couldn't be happier. A lot of times, completely wireless Bluetooth in-ear headphones will lack in sound quality due to limits of the technology. Not so here! They sound great, and the battery life is killer so far. Cannot recommend these enough. Don't pay more for the hip brand name. Anker will do well by you.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kawalec

customer_reviews.title: Avoid these
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 pairs of these, and the same experience with both pairs. They pair easily and sound fine. The problem is that after only a few uses, they stop working. With both pairs, they would spontaneously turn themselves off (and thus disconnect from the source.) And the bizarrely, on both pairs I've owned, the right earphone just stopped working. It won't power up at all. I've tried turning on and off, putting back in case, re-charging (they are definitely charged). You can't even reset it because it simply won't power up. At this point I think I'll just pay up and get actual AirPods, because these things are duds.
customer_reviews.author: CBB

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for the perfect wireless earbuds for awhile now and I couldn’t be happier with these! The battery life is amazing. My earbuds themselves have never died since they are always charging in the case. I use these every day for at least an hour, and I’ve only had to charge the case once per week for 2 hours! They fit perfectly in my ears and have never even budged during intense workouts where I’m sweating a lot. The connection is immediate when you open the case and put them in your ear! Many people have compared these earbuds to Apple wireless earbuds, which are double the price. These are definitely worth the money and a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: It hurts to write this
customer_reviews.text: I must say, these are terrible. I have returned them twice under warranty and the 3rd set is having the same problem. The left ear bud constantly un-pairs every 1-2 minutes for 10 seconds then rejoins and plays again. Sometimes it gets slightly behind the right and creates an echo effect that lasts until you put it back in the charger and take it out to re-pair. I would return these again but after 3 pairs with the same issue, I am giving up. It is sad because I love this brand and the other model from them I have works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well in stereo
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a right ear only headset, this will serve the function. There is a delay between the right and left ear, which is quite perturbing. If you plan to use this for music--don't. The treble is extremely loud and there is almost no bass.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Severe delays while watching videos
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these primarily to watch movies on my iPad without disturbing people around me. Unfortunately the audio delay is so severe that using the headphones for video is impossible. I tried using both my iPhone 8 and the iPad with similar results. I attempted to connect to an apple TV but with no way to control the volume they are unusable. I never had any of the connection issues that other reviewers mentioned. The sound quality is acceptable, however if you’re expecting a lot of bass you may be dissatisfied. If your plan is music or phone only these headphones are perfectly acceptable. In my case it seems that a return is my option.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved these today after using a promo code to save 16 bucks (SDCAIR02) found code while reading about these earbuds. They definitely sound really good. I have had no issues. Bass is good but it’s not going to be huge bass your would expect but good enough. Fits good in my ear with the ones that come with it. I can’t find any complaints with them at all. I mean for the price and the brand you can’t beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Expectations Exceeded!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these earbuds!! I was really surprised by the high quality sound and noise cancellation when I first used them, and I swear the battery life is much longer than advertised. My only complaint is that they scratch pretty easily. I dropped these earbuds in the case one time and the case popped open, strewing the contents across the pavement. The back of one of the earbuds actually detached, though it snapped right back on. Now there are several tiny dents in the earbuds. Ironically, the case doesn't have a scratch on it! All in all, this is a great purchase that I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: These ear buds are a good Apple alternative. The sound quality is OK, but you must use the fat ear tips to get any base or noise reduction from outside. They stay in with active head movements. The battery life claims are true: 5 hours play time, 4 recharges in the case (i.e 20 hours play time) before the case needs recharging. I had a problem with the first pair that was delivered. Customer service was great. They checked them while on the phone, and immediately sent out a new pair. They arrived in 1 day.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Berney

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad set of ear pods...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these instead of AirPods (which I have had before but my wife lost them!). Figured these might be a less expensive alternative. They fit nicely and have adjustable ear pieces, they do not fall out in the gym, even if I sweat. They do block out any outside noise very nicely. The sound is good, but the volume is not near as loud as the Apple Air Pods, but maybe there is better for my ears! All in all, I am pleased, my only drawback is I wish the volume was higher... The battery lasts a long time. They charge with a MicroUSB charger.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Evitt

customer_reviews.title: Bad mic, maybe got a defect
customer_reviews.text: The overall sound quality and bluetooth connectivity of the headphones are very good. However, the pair I received had very bad microphone reception. Calls on the other end would hear a lot of noise and voice would be muffled and scratchy. Not sure if I received a defect as I don't see other reviews mentioning the same problem. Returned mine and looking for better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Techie

customer_reviews.title: This works great for me, I am going deaf, if I turn my TV up loud my wife yells at me !
customer_reviews.text: I have a Samsung smart TV that I can pair with and get crystal clear sound directly to my ears and enjoy terrific sound with out my wife even hearing the TV ! These buds deliver sound like I have not heard in year’s I had a problem with the first set of pods I bought and and they were promptly replaced! ,! A great company to deal with, such prompt service is refreshing. love them buds, you can’t go wrong with them !
customer_reviews.author: Don G

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good, battery life pretty bad for an Anker product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like them. The cool factor is there, the sound is good, not excellent. The only issue is the battery. It barely lasts five hours. It also takes quite a bit of time for it to charge fully. The left ear didn't work out of the box. Turns out the right charged fully first and then only the left started. Not both together. Which I thought was odd. I exchanged my first pair thinking that I got a defective pair but the second set did the same thing. I figured buying from Anker (the unofficial battery kings) that it would be on par with today's market of true wireless at least.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity cuts out semi-frequently.
customer_reviews.text: It was between these and the AirPods, but I antes better noise cancellation which in-ear promised. I saw decent reviews online. Two weeks of ownership in, the headphones will cut out for 1 second intervals sporadically about 50 times a day, and it sometimes distorts the sound quality equally as random in occurrence. Really hoping to return these and actually spend the +$40 to get the AirPods. Big downside is that I have such little time to complain + ship these back or whatever they need me to do. Disappointed in the purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: zac sweis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic alternative to Airpods
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use these at work and so not in a high-noise environment, but they perform quite well for the task. I think the sound quality is good, but I do not play loud music in them (as you should not with earbuds, my ears are already damaged enough!) - but response is good and I have not noticed issues with bass or high notes. The main attraction is the case and battery life - they easily last for two weeks on a charge, as the case charges them up when stored; when the case runs down just plug it in for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Decent alternative to AirPods
customer_reviews.text: I like these, but I don't love them. They sound pretty good. They don't always stay in my ears too well, which is disappointing. Like most Anker products I have owned, the battery life has seemed to rapidly decline from when they were brand new. Would I buy again? Probably. For the price, they are pretty good. Just manage your expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A complete dud
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Anker Soundcore Liberty Air that work well but unfortunately, this newer generation pair that I bought for my wife for Christmas have been a complete dud. They don't fully charge, and don't STAY charged. The earbuds would cut in and out when listening to anything, and now the Left earbud has completely stopped working altogether. She has only listened to them (or attempted to) about 10 times. They haven't been dropped or damaged in any way on our end. Just a complete dud. Customer support will be contacted when they open Monday.
customer_reviews.author: metzgerf

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud won’t connect
customer_reviews.text: These were fine for about six weeks, but now the left earbud will not connect to the right one and therefore doesn’t play. I’ve been through all the reset steps multiple times with the same result. It’s frustrating that the left one is basically useless now since it won’t connect to the right. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product with low-level of customer support
customer_reviews.text: I have a high expectation buying this earbud from Anker since they are known for their stuff. However, I am disappointed big time. After using the earbud for 15 minutes, the left earbud stops working. I tried to do everything I can to fix it, but it is still not working. I reached out to customer support to ask for help, and Anker kept asking me a ton of questions, to the point where I feel they are just trying to cover the defects of their product. I am super disappointed, and would not recommend anyone from buying Anker's product.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This review is coming from an individual who has purchased like 10 different wireless earbuds on amazon with the aim of finding an earbud with Rich sound (bass esp) ,build quality, good battery life, noise cancellation etc. The top three so far are 1.Cowin KY03 2. Soundcore Liberty Air 3. Soundpeats The build quality of the Soundcore Liberty Air is amazing and it is very sleek.
customer_reviews.author: NanaGenfi

customer_reviews.title: Noise canceling for sleep. Sound quality is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t sleep without these. I’m such a light sleeper and also very sensitive to loud noises. I use these earbuds constantly and they muffle noise so well I can finally relax. The sound quality is amazing for these tiny little things. At first the left earbud wasn’t playing on my iPhone but was working with my iPad. Not sure if it started because I kept trying to pair it over and over but it works now. The battery lasts a long time and it charges fast. I love these so much I have thought about buying another pair so when I’m charging one I can use the other lol. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Buy these instead of AirPods!
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine and are great so far! Bought these after losing my AirPods a few months ago, these are nearly as good as AirPods at half the price. Sound quality is arguably better. Only negative so far is connection can be a little more difficult than AirPods, but once I figured it out, they seem to connect nearly as seamlessly. Definitely would save the $80 and buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Close second!
customer_reviews.text: As an Apple user, let's face it, the Apple Ear Pods are overpriced. These are a REAL close second. Many choices on ear molds. Fits great! Sound is pretty decent. Good bass and very good highs. If you get them fitted properly (again, several molds to choose from), these will block the outside noise. No connection issues. Takes a while to get used to the touch controls. No complaints. Not sure why there are so many 1 stars. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome earbuds for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome earbuds for the price. And awesome customer service. My first pair stopped connecting to my phone for some reason after about 2 weeks. So I emailed them and had a new pair in my hands in 3 days. I've had the new pair for about a month now, and other then some weird connection glitches here and there these are awesome earbuds! Range is about 50-60ft through walls using Bluetooth 5.0, can't complain about that. Battery life is great for a college kid, haven't had them die on me yet. One thing I would like would be if I could listen to the left earbud by itself like I can with the right.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: UTTER FRUSTRATION
customer_reviews.text: Well these headphones worked really well for a few months but if you have a situation where they need to be reset it is nothing but utter frustration. I basically want to throw them in the trash. I have wasted hours trying to reset to get the left earbud to work with no success. I have tried every video and instruction available, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Bates

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, except...
customer_reviews.text: So, I read a review saying these are a cheaper alternative to a more popular ear bud that only comes in white on the market. And it is. It sounds and functions exactly like the more expensive competitor. Sound is really great. If noise cancellation is your thing. Try them out. I however can’t use them and am returning them. I can’t find a bud that fits my ear. They fall out no matter what. I’ve tried a different tip from other manufactures. Nada. If you have a good ear canal, these will be great. Not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Seabiscuit

customer_reviews.title: Touch controls could use some improvments
customer_reviews.text: This would be 4.5 to 5 stars if this didn't have such terrible touch controls. ***UPDATE*** Anker reached out to me about my touch controls issues and I was very very pleased with their customer service. I currently own 4 pairs of Anker bluetooth earphones (soundbuds curve, soundbuds slim, liberty air, and liberty neo). I use all of them often and will definitely buy from them in the future
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months. LOVED them until they just quit.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED these headphones. I was so excited to have truly wireless and super easy to use headphones. I’ve used them almost every day since I’ve gotten them...today they just don’t pair with my phone anymore. They aren’t showing up in any of my devices anymore. They are charged up and haven’t been dropped or misused in any way but the Bluetooth feature must have quit working. I’m incredibly disappointed that I’m now without headphones after spending all that money and the return window is closed since it’s been 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I love these ear buds but had difficulty pairing them. Figuring it was user error, I called Anker and got an awesome Tech named Malcolm who walked me through trying to reset them, figured our one one of the buds wasn't working properly, and promptly offered to send me a new pair. Super kind, super knowledgeable, and super responsive. What else could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Left earbud not working at all
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my girlfriend for valentine's day and I bought the older model to save a few bucks. Sadly the left earphone has not worked since day one out of the box. Hard to review the othe features when literally 50% of product is not working.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Slanis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know I needed these so much.
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible. I really enjoy the old Gumy earbud shape and these are similar to those. Play around with the earbud tips and rotation of the best to find your ideal fit. Read the manual! Someone's review mentioned training yourself to start with a lower volume and work your way up, and I second that! The sound quality is beautiful, the connection range is great, I love these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bluetooth Connection - Controls Do Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have listened to all of the bad reviews. The bluetooth connection broke up immediately. That's pretty important for bluetooth headphones! The controls on the earbuds did not work (maybe 5% of the times I tried). They definitely spent more on the slick packaging than the actual product because I'm not sure how you could deliver such a terrible product that does not work right out of the box (I fully charged them first). I should've learned from past Anker purchases, but these are just awful. Never again. Terrible ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: It was great while it lasted....
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our daughter last Christmas. Worked well for 6 months then the right earbud started acting up. When the volume was all the way up, you could barely hear a faint noise coming from it. Then it worked for a while off and on until last week. And since you cannot wear the left one unless you are wearing the right one is out of the case, it is pretty much useless. I don't expect them to last forever but more than 6 months would have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Legit- Half the price
customer_reviews.text: These are really good for the price. I run a lot and with these I have about 40 run miles in with these and love them, light weight and sync every-time. They are not super loud like other headphones but nor do I need blaring music plus it has sound canceling which is great. The right air phone is the master and is fine since you play/pause and forward to next song on that one if you want that like me. The fit is perfect for me with the ear piece that came with the, but they have a good selection of pieces that come with this set
customer_reviews.author: jeffery norville

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer service - 5+
customer_reviews.text: My Soundcore headphones had issues with turning off when in the case. I contacted Customer Service and Britney first tried to help over the phone by instructing me on the proper use of the headphones. When the problem persisted, she sent me a replacement unit! This service is unparalleled in my experience, and is exemplary of what "focus on customer" service is all about. Moreover, the headphones fit well in my ears and have a nice sound. Keep it up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Great service for a very good product. I bought these in January and used them quite a bit. They have good sound, good noise canceling. The battery lasts awhile, and with the charging case, a quick recharge couldn’t be simpler. After about 6 months, they weren’t charging correctly, though. The left one wouldn’t charge more than half the time. After some troubleshooting, I couldn’t figure it out. This is the biggest reason for the 5 star review. I contacted Anker, who sent me a new set of earbuds for free. Can’t beat a very good sounding headphone for the price, especially with such great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan VS

customer_reviews.title: I’m not that technologically challenged so I’m pretty sure they were broken
customer_reviews.text: I think I may have just gotten sent a faulty product- or maybe the product really truly is subpar. Never truly figured out what was wrong with it- tried to get free tech help that allegedly came with my purchase. But I think the earbud that’s suppose to be the control center came broken therefore rendering these useless. I returned it and have yet to find some earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: good but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a year. I'd give them five stars except the left one won't charge anymore and I've tried everything i can think of. But the sound and battery life have been really good.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Zedemore

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easily worth double the asking price!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, the best bass of all earbuds. Pretty decent at cancelling noise and easy to charge. Classical music never sounded better. Only downside is the on-off button is very sensitive. If you adjust the right bud you can accidentally turn it off. Battery life is good for 2-3 hours of continuous play.
customer_reviews.author: cat5fred

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these (third pair I've tried, send the others back) just weeks before reading the CNET review (they loved them). Just ordered a pair for my son!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Great...until they aren't. Wanted to love them!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 5/10/19: Anker customer service was awesome as usual and I have a new pair on the way. :) I literally loved these and chose to use them exclusively after selecting a few over the year and trying them out. Unfortunately, these started cutting out randomly in my left earbud for no reason. I thought I could deal but then it got too often. I'm hoping Anker will let me try again because I'd hate to not have them.
customer_reviews.author: llclsu

customer_reviews.title: Sound good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received the Liberty Air 2 today. They are very comfortable and light. Downloaded the configuration App and updated the software, very easy to use. The different EQ settings are very helpful in obtaining a sound which sounds good to me. A very nice added feature. My initial impression is very positive, happy with my purchase. Amazon scheduled delivery for next Monday, but delivered purchase early on Friday.... 4 days early :)
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good but not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these but I couldn’t get my first pair to work at all so they were exchanged and after two months of only light use One of the sides doesn’t seem to be working consistently. Have tried troubleshooting but it’s a little annoying to only year out of one side. Other than that, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: twoo

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The charging case is brilliant. Minuses are they don’t stay in my ears. I can’t figure how and where to tap on them to change songs or volume. And, my coworkers can hear my music if I use them at my desk. I wear them to watch tv to pass the time while drying my hair. For that they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended these earphones to me. So far they are good. I am having trouble learning how to operate which sides does what; but I know this will get better over time. I wished I had purchased the black ones; I am washing them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: SChapman

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy 1st generation
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Sound quality is better or similar to AirPods. - Fits great and secure. Cons: - Charger case has serious design issues. You have to clean it OFTEN. And my charger case only works if I keep it vertically. Earbuds are out of charge all the time because I forget to put the case on a table vertically. - Just 6 months after purchase sound quality became from 5/5 to 2/5. It sounds like a robot, can't use it anymore. And I used this pair a very few times though. Because I am tired to remember and charge them properly. So I use them rarely and they died so quickly anyway. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless for the money
customer_reviews.text: I did have an issue with these at first but the Anker support team has always been great. Very good sound quality and I think they're a great value for the price. Worth noting, I do not use these to make phone calls, only audio. Overall quality if very good, I have tried cheap alternatives and found them to all be trash. If you want a good pair for less than $90, these are your earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Q

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: Hi dear, My name is Vlad Farcas. I ordered a pair of headphones on 08/11/2019 from your company. I was very excited to try it because I wanted for so long. Unfortunately when I take it out from the box and tried it, the left side of it, did not work so good. To be more specific it just worked occasionally. Please tell me what are the steps to get a new one which works better. Thank you for your help.
customer_reviews.author: Farcas Vlad Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the price. Good sound quality, tight fit
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is awesome, one of the best when I purchased one (now there are better ones and the updated liberty air 2 in the market. No issues with connections, no noticeable lag, light and comfortable design. Call quality is not impressive, especially if you compare it to some of the new models in the market. But it is very good for public transport and generally listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Farshid

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to AirPods!
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I wanted true wireless earbuds without the AirPods price tag, and SoundGuys highly recommended these. They're SUPER comfortable, offer great sound and range, and rarely if ever cut out. My only complaint is the mic is not very good for making phone calls, unless you're in a quiet room, but that's likely the case with any true wireless earbuds. Highly recommend! Customer service was also great when I needed to replace a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but not perfect for audio calls
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, if you buy them for audio, they are good, but for calls usually they don`t fit. Microphone is not well adapted for phone calls. Buds are note fit perfectly in ears, for sports they can fall. Bought separately foam buds to fit better. If anker would produce for them buds with hooks, they could fit more stable. Need some improvements. Battery life is reasonable apx. 4h, charging time also quite good, controls also are reasonable. Sound volume could be bigger, if it is nosy it is hard to listen.
customer_reviews.author: Grigore T.

customer_reviews.title: Connection issue after 1.5 years of working issue-free...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pair of headset for 1.5 years now. It was fine but now I am having connectivity issues. I use this when I exercise and the left ear piece keeps on getting disconnected and reconnected. It got really annoying! I am going to contact Anker Customer service and see what they say...
customer_reviews.author: shainsley

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet compared to other headphones
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the quietest pair of headphones I've ever used. Even after trying many rubber tip sizes, the bass especially seems to be very lacking (comparing to taotronics bluetooth headphones, airpods, and basically any wired headphones I've ever used). Hardly seems to get louder beyond ~75% volume. If you like blasting your ears with sound (hopefully in short bursts to preserve your ear's health) do not get these!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Not as much bass as stated in description
customer_reviews.text: I do not think they have very much bass the reviews were good, I had a pair of $50 playbeatz that looked a lot like the Apple AirPods 2, before these and the bass was much better. The Ankara sound good if you like a lot of highs and mods but the bass is not that good. I do like the different size tips for the Anker, it makes them stay in ears better.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy W.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. They look like AirPods, but they don’t act like AirPods. If I don’t use them for a day or so, the battery will drain completely and then you have to wait too long to use them. They are really hard to pair the first time and the directions are unclear. Though, when you can finally get them working they do sound nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Better than air pods
customer_reviews.text: These things sound better than my air pods and fit in my ear better. They have a very long battery life and connect to your phone right when you remove them from the case. The reason the get a one star for noise cancellation is because they don’t have Noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: underrated
customer_reviews.text: Good size, comfortable fit, good sound. Bluetooth connects faster and has longer range than my cheaper headphones. Happy with these and don't need to upgrade to airpods.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to Airpods if not better
customer_reviews.text: This product really beats the Airpods in sound quality even though it doesn't have the same features. Connectivity is extensive and stable. The bass really surprised me. I tested it with my Android phone, iPad, and Asus laptop. The results were positive and consistently good. Phone calls see clear.
customer_reviews.author: JingJingLu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth the money! I use these every day at work. The sound quality is awesome. Not suuuuper loud, but I don’t like it that loud personally. I usually only have the right one in and I can get a solid 14 hours maybe more out of it. I have yet to use them all the way down to no battery.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with these earphones! It has been difficult finding a pair that for my small ears. I'm not an apple user, so those after not an option. All other earphones just don't fit or i have trouble connecting to my phone. I have tried many others only to be disappointed. These sound amazing, hold a very long charge, are well made, compact, easy to use, and easily connect to my phone-no issues. I would definitely buy again if I lose or break these.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Anglesey

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sound good for low cost true wireless buds and the noise isolation is pretty good. Contrary to the manufacturer claims, these will never go past 2 hours of low volume listening. They also will occasionally not fully seat in the charger and fail to charge one or both.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Great value for true wireless headphones, mediocre touch controls and BT drops happen
customer_reviews.text: They're great headphones with good sound quality. They do slip out of my ears a little bit, and the touch controls aren't great but I can live with those minor issues. My only real complaint is the Bluetooth connection drops. The left earbud frequently disconnects and it can be a frustrating experience. When they work, they're great.
customer_reviews.author: morteum

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: Mine wouldn’t stay charged beyond 5 minutes of play time. I ran through all the steps to try and fix the problem but ended-up having to return them. They sounded nice when they worked but I must have had a defective pair.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones! Sound good, long battery life and great price!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing! They sound good, have a long battery life and relatively no connectivity issues. I get about 3 charges out of the case before I have to charge it again and about 4-5 hours from the headphones themselves before they need recharging.
customer_reviews.author: ukdal1

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: These suck. Now on paper they’re amazing, but the issue here is not with battery life or sound quality, it’s with the connectivity. I bought a pair of these for my Girlfriend and they WOULD NOT STOP DISCONNECTING. I’m not joking, every five minutes they would disconnect, unbelievable. Wouldn’t recommend if that has to be said.
customer_reviews.author: Asher

customer_reviews.title: Good quality to price.
customer_reviews.text: I like almost everything about these pair. Audio quality may not the best however I use them for audiobooks so it really doesn’t matter to me but I can see how it may not be up to par with some people. Good battery life and nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: Takeshi Nishikawa

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like these but ended up returning them
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. The ear fit was only good when it was sealed in your ear, but that tightness became uncomfortable after a lot of adjustment and wear. The blue tooth was spotty. Especially when trying to connect to my MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were just ok. They were pretty good as far as listening goes, not being independent sucked but they tell you so if you read and still buy them you can’t complain. My main problem was battery life. They died every hour or 2 and you couldn’t use one while charging the other, so you just had to take a 30 min break from music to charge them. As a student sitting in the library for four hours, I would want headphones that last me the whole time, let alone a day, and these weren’t it
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Anker’s SoundCore 5-Star Wireless Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and a great price make the SoundCore Liberty Air earbuds a Better Buy compared to Apple’s AirPods. To make sure, I tried out the AirPods. Yes, the SoundCore earbuds are the real deal. Highly recommended 😊
customer_reviews.author: Idaho resident

customer_reviews.title: Crooked company
customer_reviews.text: Product was great for 10 months. My initial set quit charging and would connect to my phone while they were in the charging case. I called Anker and they agreed to replace them under warranty. Here is where the fun starts: I received my replacement pair today, I unboxed and charged as recommended. The left ear bud was completely dead. Called for yet another replacement and the representative admitted that they send returned products as warranty replacements. If you are submitting a warranty you may receive my broken pods back. MAKE A BETTER PRODUCT TO BEGIN WITH, CROOKED COMAPNY
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase at the right price
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great and clear. They do their job whenever I use them. Once you set them up for the first time, bluetooth connection works immediately after that. The price is right and it did not break my budget. I’m very happy about this purchase. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DTor

customer_reviews.title: They don’t stay paired with you or Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Every time I take these out of the charger, I need to re-pair them, not just reconnect. This is a major hassle because first you need to un-pair of them. They will not reconnect unless you un-pair and then re-pair. The sound quality and battery life is good, but these headphones miss the mark. This problem happens on iPhone, and on my computer - I do not recommend these headphones
customer_reviews.author: Ben Grossman

customer_reviews.title: 98% satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: I started using it this morning on my train ride. So far so good. I love them. They fit well and secured in the ears, they sound well with the audio, noise cancellation works well, easy to pair. The only thing that I wish to have is the volume control on the ear buds. But with less than half price of the top brands in the market, I guess we can't be too picky. To be precise, I am 98% satisfied with this pair of ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Anker and I really wanted these to be awesome especially since they are a higher priced item but they are just okay. It would probably be best to pass on these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening, not for speaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for all the video calls I am now doing. To listen, the sound quality is just fine. The earbuds are comfortable and stay in place. However, the microphone quality leaves a lot to be desired. People have said my voice comes through choppy and distorted, although I can hear them just fine. I have tried unpairing and repairing, but without great success. I'll try for another couple days, but I may end up returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn Bluetooth Connection
customer_reviews.text: The sound and noise cancelation are great and the battery life is superb. I love that. However, the Bluetooth connection can be tricky. The headphones often don't connect on the first try or they disconnect on their own. That gets frustrating when receiving calls from work and can't hear each other. Overall great product, just unsure if worth $75 due to the connectivity issues..
customer_reviews.author: HolidayShopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support team!
customer_reviews.text: Received earbuds quickly but was unable to get them to work properly. Contacted customer support easily and they sent out a replacement the same day. Highly recommend anker support and the replacement works perfectly. The buds are of very good quality and the support team is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: BillP

customer_reviews.title: My wife says they are great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife. She says they are a great product. Great sound, great calling, great battery. I myself, haven't tested them, but she wanted some headphones for work and so far they have been great for her. She only uses one earpiece, so she can hear everything around her, and again, she is happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Armendia

customer_reviews.title: What could have been
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a great alternative to AirPods, but the battery was pathetic. Even with them fully charged and in the case fully charged they only lasted 1.5 hours max. Also everytime I forgot and took the left one out to talk to someone the stupid thing would start doing a Siri search and I couldn’t cancel it. Very bummed I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED EMPTY  - didn't know until gift recipient opened the gift
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this intending it to be a present and wrapped it as soon as it arrived. When the gift was opened, the box was empty. I did not open it to check that the product was inside because this never happened to me before. Unfortunately, due to work/travel/illness, I missed the window to return the empty box. This experience, including the return window, has made me reconsider using Amazon for purchases. Lesson learned: I'm going to take a hard pass on using Amazon for gifts and electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Brady

customer_reviews.title: Far better than Apple Airpods - Another Anker product for the win!
customer_reviews.text: Way better than AirPods. First of all, I despise Apple after all the products I’ve owned and still own because I refuse to switch but these headphones are definitely 1 exception! Anker products are higher quality than apple and way cheaper. The battery for these lasts so long, I keep 1 in my ear all day going from the car to work, etc. To listen to podcasts all day.
customer_reviews.author: Myriah Combs

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Customer Service!!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love these headphones! They have incredible noise cancellation (which is saying a lot for someone in NYC!) They're super comfortable and don't fall out like a lot of headphones do for me. I prefer them over airpods because of the touch features on the side. Also, I lost my charging case and the customer service team was super helpful in getting me a replacement one! Very communicative and would definitely work with them again!
customer_reviews.author: James M Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product didn’t work for me due to intermittent disconnectivity. However Anker customer support made things right with a refund of the full amount. Because of their great customer service I’ll continue to buy Anker products.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds not so good charging case
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife for Christmas. She loved them out of the gate but within a month we were having minor connection issues and issues with the charging case. The charging case appears to be fairly temperamental when trying to plug in
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is the third set I have tried and the best so far. The fit is pretty, no back ground noise. The quality of sound is really good. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and we love these over AirPods
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine at target and then bought these one for my daughters birthday! They are clear and sound cancelling. Hold charge really well and for a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Colbert

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to reconnect to phone
customer_reviews.text: I can connect to cell phone then when I need them again. Takes to long to get them connected. Sound was good, I didnt like the fit. Seem too big, uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Woods Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the earphones
customer_reviews.text: These are my first wireless, blue tooth earphones. They were very easy to set up on my phone, charged fast and they hold their charge for a long time. They are comfortable. The sound quality is very good and the noise cancelling is good.
customer_reviews.author: edmondslady

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good and they charge quickly. The only drawback is that the lack of buttons makes it difficult to use the various features to control the paired device, like changing the volume or moving forward to the next podcast. Overall, though, they are a good buy, especially for the coupon price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for being true wireless
customer_reviews.text: Earbud box came a bit damaged, but product inside perfectly fine. Sound quality isn't quite what I wanted, but I wanted to try a true wireless set for the gym. If you need no wires at all I would try these. Personally I'll be getting bluetooth headphones with the band next time for better sound for the same or lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lovely airpod alternative for android users
customer_reviews.text: I've had these since September and have had no issues with them so far. The battery life is incredible, the noise cancellation is great, and they don't fall out when I work out in them. I've never used them for calls so I can't comment on the sound quality there, but they do everything I want them to do and are fantastic for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless earphones!
customer_reviews.text: I thought about getting wireless earphones for a long time and was overwhelmed with all the choices. I’m very happy with my purchase. The sound quality is good and they don’t slip out of my ears. If you look at other reviews outside of Amazon they are better. These earphones are compared to Apple AirPods on other sites and score higher than on Amazon. Airpods on a budget that are really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No longer charge...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but now the carrier won’t charge which means I can’t charge the ear buds. Now they just sit in the drawer... spend more money to get better quality or know that they won’t last longer then 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: mark harris

customer_reviews.title: Started malfunctioning after only a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: I was really stoked to get these after my girlfriend bought them and loved them. Unfortunately, mine have started having problems after only a couple of months. The left earbud will cut in and out constantly and often times they will just suddenly turn off or disconnect. My girlfriend hasn’t had any problems with hers so they’re good headphones but the consistency of the quality is definitely lacking and now I’m out almost $80.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was good. Biggest issue is after 9 months the left earbud stopped playing sound. It could still turn the set on and off, just no sound. I have 2 of these and both do the same thing. Returned one pair as the other was out of warranty, the replacement set did the same thing after 6 months. Overall if they stayed working would have been a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee P. Engle

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: got replacement and product is highly recommended. great sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

product_meta.title: Soundcore Liberty Air True Wireless Earphones with Charging Case, Bluetooth 5, 28 Hour Playtime, Touch Control Earbuds, Graphene Enhanced Sound, Noise Cancelling Microphones and Secure Fit (White)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteSoundcore|Hear It. Feel It. A Brand Under Anker Innovations. Advanced Audio: The graphene-coated drivers eliminate distortion to produce sound with enhanced accuracy and outstanding clarity. Enjoy detailed highs, bright mids, and satisfyingly deep bass. Enhanced Voice Pick-Up: Two built-in microphones with uplink noise cancellation filter out external noise to boost clarity and quality. Your voice sounds ultra-clear even when you are walking down a crowded city street or on a packed train to work. Long Battery Life: Anker charging technology and a new-generation Bluetooth chipset ensures ultra-efficient battery usage. An industry-leading 5 hours of playtime is boosted to 20 hours via the included charging case. Touch Control: Discreet touchpads in Liberty Air earbuds allow you to use effortless touch commands to answer calls, as well as play, pause, and skip music. Bluetooth 5.0: The latest Bluetooth technology ensures an ultra-stable connection for skip-free music. Water-Resistant: Liberty Air earbuds are IPX5-rated for effective protection against liquids. Note: Suitable for use with iPhone and Android devices.
feature_bullets: 【Graphene-Enhanced Sound】: Pioneering audio technology delivers highly accurate sound with superior clarity.
【Dual Microphones with Uplink Noise Cancellation】: Enhances voice pick-up and filters out ambient noise for crystal-clear call quality.
【5-Hour Playtime from a Single Charge】: Use the charging case for an additional 15 hours of playtime.
【Integrated Touch Contro】l: Use the earbuds to play, pause, and skip music and answer calls on-the-go.
【Stereo Calls】: Hear the other person's voice in both earbuds for an enhanced call experience.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,673 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
